turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Mélamare.
turn.2: Mélamare Mélamare is a commune in the Seine-Maritime department in the Normandy region in northern France.
turn.4: A farming town in the Pays de Caux, situated some east of Le Havre, near the junction of the D34 and D312 roads.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Tradition holds that Saint Honorina (Sainte-Honorine) was martyred here in 303AD.
turn.7: Is there any proof of this?
turn.8: There is a chapel dedicated to her in the town.
turn.9: What else is notable about Melamare?
turn.10: The town name was recorded as "Mellomara" in the thirteenth century.
turn.12: After the revocation of the Edict of Nantes, Protestantism survived here clandestinely.
